text: An apology has more impact when it's specific.
author: Gary Chapman

text: Those we care about most are those most affected by our apologies.
author: Gary Chapman

text: Apologizing to oneself requires self-talk.
author: Gary Chapman

text: What most people are looking for in an apology is sincerity.
author: Gary Chapman

text: For an apology to be accepted, you need to speak the language that conveys to the offended your sincerity.
author: Gary Chapman

text: Expressing regret is the emotional aspect of an apology.
author: Gary Chapman

text: Anytime an apology is followed by an excuse for the offense, the excuse cancels out the apology in my mind.
author: Gary Chapman

text: A sincere apology will deepen the relationship rather than destroy it.
author: Gary Chapman

text: The quicker and more thorough the apology, the more likely the apologizer is to receive genuine forgiveness and restoration of the relationships.
author: Gary Chapman

text: A forgiving person stands ready to forgive when an apology is offered.
author: Gary Chapman

text: When no apology is forthcoming, a forgiving person will take the initiative to lovingly confront the person in the wrong and offer forgiveness.
